definition: to change into/to turn into/to become
to change/to become different/to transform/to vary/rebellion
to succeed/to finish/to complete/to accomplish/to become/to turn into/to be all right/OK!/one tenth
surname Cheng

sentences.english: Once (he was)a worker , Pang Long now becomes a famous singer.
sentences.chinese: 庞龙曾经是个工人，现在变成一位著名的歌手。

sentences.english: Before I got these, my allergies would turn into weeks-long sinus infections.
sentences.chinese: 在我开始使用前，过敏症状已变成持续几周的鼻炎。

sentences.english: In this way, it might be possible to turn shields—instead of swords—into plowshares .
sentences.chinese: 也许可以把防御用的盾牌变成锄头。

sentences.english: Meanwhile the Fox will come down from the mountains and will metamorphose itself into a Wolf.
sentences.chinese: 期间，狐狸会下山，会把自己变成狼。

sentences.english: The antibodies have been altered to fluoresce under certain conditions.
sentences.chinese: 在一定条件下，这些抗体被变成能发出荧光。

sentences.english: My former house has turned into a wreck of tumbled walls.
sentences.chinese: 以前的房子现在已经变成颓垣断壁了。

sentences.english: It soon turned into black smog as the smoke of the city poured into the air.
sentences.chinese: 随着城市的烟排入天空，白雾很快变成了黑色烟雾。

sentences.english: Two of them have become great buddies .
sentences.chinese: 他们两个变成很好的哥儿们。

sentences.english: Winter changes the water of heaven and the heart of man into a stone.
sentences.chinese: 冬季把天上的水和人的心都变成了冰。

sentences.english: From time to time, some of my readers take a stab at converting me to their religion.
sentences.chinese: 我的一些读者时常尝试把我转变成他们的宗教的信徒。

sentences.english: The ego has a way of turning the loftiest activities into trash if it is allowed free range.
sentences.chinese: 如果可能，自我可以把最神圣的东西变成垃圾。
毛虫在成年期会变成蝴蝶。

sentences.english: St. Petersburg had become Petrograd in 1914.
sentences.chinese: 圣彼得堡在1914年变成彼得格勒。

sentences.english: How quickly their shrieks of pain turn to enraptured adulation.
sentences.chinese: 它们痛苦的尖叫迅速转变成对吾等恩赐的狂热谄媚。

sentences.english: The two dueled, transforming the office of politics into an arena of lightsaber combat.
sentences.chinese: 他们俩展开决斗，把政府办公室变成光剑格斗场。

sentences.english: Then the 'world's largest pothole' was transformed into one of the wonders of the world.
sentences.chinese: 然后，“世界上最大的洞穴”变成了世界奇观之一。

definition: to change into
to be done/to be ready/that's enough!/that will do!
to succeed/to finish/to complete/to accomplish/to become/to turn into/to be all right/OK!/one tenth
surname Cheng
to become/to turn into
to become
to sink down to/to be reduced to (sth inferior)
no more/no longer
originally/original
to change/to become different/to transform/to vary/rebellion
see 的士[di1 shi4]
of/~'s (possessive particle)/(used after an attribute)/(used to form a nominal expression)/(used at the end of a declarative sentence for emphasis)
aim/clear
really and truly
is/are/am/yes/to be
variant of 是[shi4]/(used in given names)
original/former/originally/formerly/at first/so, actually, as it turns out
to lose
I've got a solution!/to have a bun in the oven (abbr. for 有了胎[you3 le5 tai1])
to consider as/to take to be
to resemble/to be like/to look as if/such as/appearance/image/portrait/image under a mapping (math.)
